posts.title: Remember
posts.excerpt: Quote: Atom Egoyan’s ongoing search for his own best form makes no real breakthrough in “Remember,” a state-hopping Nazi-hunt mystery that puts a creditably sincere spin on material that is silly at best. At worst, tyro writer Benjamin August’s screenplay is a crass attempt to fashion a “Memento”-style puzzle narrative from post-Holocaust trauma. Toggling variables …

posts.title: The Danish Girl (2015)
posts.excerpt: Quote: A fictitious love story loosely inspired by the lives of Danish artists Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener. Lili and Gerda’s marriage and work evolve as they navigate Lili’s groundbreaking journey as a transgender pioneer.

posts.title: Stantsionnyy smotritel
posts.excerpt: Quote: In May, 1816 narrator passes through a small station. At the station, Dunia, Beauty daughter of the superintendent, serves tea. posts.title: Sanam
posts.excerpt: Plot Summary: In a small valley, riders pursue and kill a man. A horse thief, so his assassins claim. But for his ten year old son Issa, the disappearance of his father causes an avalanche of problems. With the family name stigmatized, Issa is bullied by the other children in the village. While his mother …

posts.title: Nouvelle Vague
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Nouvelle Vague marks the beginning of a period in Jean-Luc Godard’s career in which he made films that looked back on his previous work. In these retrospective films, Godard asked himself whether it is possible to continue as a film director under the conditions imposed by international commercial cinema. Appropriately enough, Nouvelle Vague concerns …

posts.title: Beed-o baad
posts.excerpt: Quote: A school window is broken, and kids can’t concentrate because the rain is getting in. The culprit isn’t allowed back into class until he mends it. posts.title: Denise Calls Up
posts.excerpt: Synopsis by Mark Deming Thanks to the technological marvels of wireless phones, answering machines, the internet, and e-mail, it is no longer necessary actually to see anyone you know, and seven friends have taken this notion to its logical extreme in this comedy. posts.title: Frágil Como o Mundo
posts.excerpt: Quote: An impossible love. Two young people in love. Vera and John can’t find a space nor time, nor identity in this life that can solve this love.
